description: personal study ID composed by the first authors’ first surname_year of publication_first title word
year the data point was obtained
month the data point was obtained
day of the month the data point was obtained
name of the participant
age presented in years – see metadata for source of age
sex of the participant
role of the participant 1 – focal_participant_right
name of the participant_2
age presented in years of the participant_2  – see metadata for source of age
sex of the participant_2
role of the participant_2 – focal_participant_left
species of individuals participating in the study -chimpanzee
name of the two participants that compose the dyad
sex of the participants (male (both males)/ female (both females)/ mix (female and male))
species subgroup at time of data collection – WKPRC chimpanzee group a or b/ etc
phases in which participants were paired:  Phase 1 = initial phase. Phase 2 = final phase. After indviduals completed four cooperative training sessions with a human partner between phases
set of trials - mostly occurring on the same day - usually numerical
presentation of the experiment to the participants - usually numerical
condition bot (bottom / social dilemma) or top (competition)
whether the participant on the left pulled
whether the participant on the right pulled
whether the participant on the left succeeded to obtain any reward
whether the participant on the left succeeded to obtain any reward

efficiency score based on the the number of individuals that obtained at least a reward on a given trial: 0 = no pair member obtained a reward/ 1 = one pair member obtained at least a reward/ 2 = both pair members obtained rewards
number of grapes obtained by the participant on the left side
number of grapes obtained by the participant on the right side
latency to start pulling from the left side
latency to start pulling from the right side
minimum latency between both sides
whether they coordinated (pull together all the way up or down and share rewards)
